revised_title: Effects of Linearly Increasing Ambient Temperature on Exothermic Reactions in a Closed System
tldr: This study investigates the effects of a linearly increasing ambient temperature on an exothermic reaction in a closed system. The authors present a new model for power-compensated differential scanning calorimetry, which considers the dynamic process of heating a reactive sample continuously. This model provides a clear and compact description of the reaction's behavior for all useful operating conditions, improving the accuracy of determining kinetic parameters.
